invitationDate.description: The estimated date of dispatch of the invitations to participate or to submit bids.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the criterion.

minimum.title: Minimum value or level
minimum.description: The minimum value or level of compliance a candidate needs to meet in order to participate.

id.title: Shareholder ID
id.description: A local identifier for this shareholder, unique within this block. This field is used to keep track of multiple revisions of a shareholder through the compilation from release to record mechanism.

shareholder.title: Shareholder organization reference.
shareholder.description: An organization reference pointing the entry in the parties section for the shareholding organization.

shareholding.title: Shareholding
shareholding.description: The percentage of shares held by the shareholder, expressed as a decimal value between 0 and 1.

votingRights.title: Shareholder voting rights
votingRights.description: Specify the type of voting rights associated with the shares held by the shareholder against the voting rights codelist.

votingRightsDetails.title: Shareholder voting rights details
votingRightsDetails.description: Detailed information about the shareholder's voting rights. This field should be completed when the shareholder voting rights are restricted, additional or enhanced.

notes.title: Shareholder notes
notes.description: Additional notes on this shareholder. This field should be used to provide details on any caps on equity transfer, or lock-in arrangements, applicable to this shareholder.

Subcontracting.title: Subcontracting
Subcontracting.description: Information about the parts of the contract that the supplier will subcontract to third parties.

description.title: Description
description.description: The description of the part of the contract that the supplier will subcontract to third parties.

maximumPercentage.title: Maximum percentage of contract value
maximumPercentage.description: The maximum percentage of the contract value that will be subcontracted.

minimumPercentage.title: Minimum percentage of contract value
minimumPercentage.description: The minimum percentage of the contract value that will be subcontracted.

competitiveMaximumPercentage.title: Maximum percentage of contract value for competitive subcontracting
competitiveMaximumPercentage.description: The maximum percentage of the contract value that the procuring entity requires the supplier to subcontract to third parties through a competitive procedure.

competitiveMinimumPercentage.title: Minimum percentage of contract value for competitive subcontracting
competitiveMinimumPercentage.description: The minimum percentage of the contract value that the procuring entity requires the supplier to subcontract to third parties through a competitive procedure.

value.title: Subcontracted value
value.description: The estimated value of the part of the contract that the supplier will subcontract to third parties.

competitive.title: Competitive subcontracting
competitive.description: Whether the supplier will subcontract part of the contract to third parties through a competitive procedure.

SubmissionTerms.title: Submission terms
SubmissionTerms.description: Information about the submission terms to describe how, when and where the tenderers need to submit their bids.

electronicSubmissionPolicy.title: Electronic submission policy
electronicSubmissionPolicy.description: Whether tenderers are required, allowed or not allowed to submit bids electronically.

variantPolicy.title: Variant policy
variantPolicy.description: Whether tenderers are required, allowed or not allowed to submit tenders which fulfill the buyer's needs differently than as proposed in the procurement documents.

electronicCataloguePolicy.title: Electronic catalogue policy
electronicCataloguePolicy.description: Whether tenderers are required, allowed or not allowed to submit bids as electronic catalogues.

languages.title: Submission language
languages.description: One or more languages in which bids or requests to participate can be submitted, using either two-letter [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes), or extended [BCP47 language tags](http://www.w3.org/International/articles/language-tags/). The use of lowercase two-letter codes from [ISO639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) is recommended.

bidValidityPeriod.title: Bid valididity period
bidValidityPeriod.description: The period, from the bid submission deadline, for which bids must remain valid.

requiresGuarantees.title: Guarantees required
requiresGuarantees.description: Whether or not a financial guarantee is required.

Techniques.title: Techniques
Techniques.description: Information about the use of techniques, such as framework agreements, dynamic purchasing systems and electronic auctions.

hasFrameworkAgreement.title: Framework agreement involved
hasFrameworkAgreement.description: Whether a framework agreement is involved.

hasDynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Dynamic purchasing system involved
hasDynamicPurchasingSystem.description: Whether a dynamic purchasing system is involved.

dynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Dynamic purchasing system
dynamicPurchasingSystem.description: Information about the dynamic purchasing system.

hasElectronicAuction.title: Electronic auction used
hasElectronicAuction.description: Whether an electronic auction is used.

maximumParticipants.title: Maximum number of participants
maximumParticipants.description: The maximum number of participants in the framework agreement. If there is no maximum, set to 1e9999 (which parses to infinity).

method.title: Method
method.description: Whether contracts are awarded with, without, or both with and without the reopening of competition.

periodRationale.title: Duration rationale
periodRationale.description: The justification for exceptional cases when the duration of a framework agreement exceeds the legal limits.

buyerCategories.title: Buyer categories
buyerCategories.description: Any additional categories of buyers participating in the framework agreement and not mentioned by name (e.g. 'all hospitals in the Tuscany region').

DynamicPurchasingSystem.title: Dynamic purchasing system
DynamicPurchasingSystem.description: Information about the dynamic purchasing system.

type.title: Type
type.description: In the case of central purchasing bodies, whether the dynamic purchasing system can be used by buyers not listed in the contracting process.

status.title: Status
status.description: The status of the dynamic purchasing system.

url.title: URL
url.description: The internet address of the electronic auction.

description.title: Description
description.description: Any additional information about the electronic auction.

UnstructuredChange.title: Unstructured change
UnstructuredChange.description: Unstructured or semi-structured change to an earlier notice.

relatedLot.title: Related lot
relatedLot.description: The identifier of the lot to which this change relates, if any.

oldValue.title: Old value
oldValue.description: The value of the data element referenced by the `where` field, before the change.

newValue.title: New value
newValue.description: The value of the data element referenced by the `where` field, after the change.

where.title: Where
where.description: A reference to a data element on an earlier notice that is being changed.

section.title: Section
section.description: The identifier of the section containing the data element, if the earlier notice is organized into sections.

label.title: Label
label.description: The label for the data element.

UnstructuredChangeValue.title: Unstructured change value
UnstructuredChangeValue.description: A value of a data element. The value must be described using only one of the fields `text`, `classifications` or `date`.

text.title: Text value
text.description: A text. If the change deleted or erased the data element, use the empty string ("").
